timeline.bodyText: I think the original name was clearer.
timeline.author: Runemoro
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,6 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_2611 net/minecraft/block/entity/EnderChestBlockEntity
 	FIELD field_12005 ticks I
 	FIELD field_12006 viewerCount I
 	FIELD field_12007 animationProgress F
-	METHOD method_11218 canPlayerUse (Lnet/minecraft/class_1657;)Z
+	METHOD method_11218 isAccessible (Lnet/minecraft/class_1657;)Z

replies.bodyText: Original name is kind of clunky, imo.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: Why not just canUse or can Access? Only a player would be using it anyway.
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText:
I wanted to avoid the canX naming, as I feel that should be reserved for checking the capabilities of this object.
Think of player.canUse(tool)
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: Inventories don't really use players, they get used by players, so the terminology is kind of backwards...
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: isOpenable?
replies.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText: canBeOpened?
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: This is not like an initial open condition but like if the player can keep opening it
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: hm ok isAccessible is ok. Perhaps isAccessibleBy?
replies.author: Prospector

replies.bodyText:
This is not like an initial open condition but like if the player can keep opening it

If that's the case, maybe I should call it canStayOpen?
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText:
That method is List.set, though: https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/docs/api/java.base/java/util/List.html#set(int,E)
There's no List.put.

timeline.bodyText: InventoryListener is better IMO (or InventoryChangeListener without the D).
timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_1265 net/minecraft/inventory/InventoryChangedListener

replies.bodyText: InventoryCallback
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
It only receives events for when an inventory's contents change. It's not a general listener for inventories, otherwise it would have onOpen and onClose.
Keeping the Change part of the class name.
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.bodyText:
The class name does not match the file name.
I think InventoryChangeListener would be better than -Callback since it fits well with other listener interfaces named *Listener in Yarn.
timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@

replies.bodyText:
@Juuxel Changed back to -Listener.
I'd originally gone with -Callback because I'd thought that was what we already used everywhere else.

timeline.bodyText:
When used on a BlockEntity for example it may not be clear what some of these methods mean.
onOpen what opened?
isValid what is valid?
In the sense of a Inventory on its own this may make sense, but not where its commonly used.
